meanings.definition: To cause annoyance or trouble to
meanings.sent1: The loud music was bothering me during my study time.
meanings.sent2: Stop bothering your sister while she is trying to read.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing mosquito kept bothering the picnic guests.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise was bothering her like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was bothering him so much that he fixed it immediately.

meanings.definition: To take the time or trouble to do something
meanings.sent1: She was bothering to clean every corner of the house.
meanings.sent2: I will bother to call you later to discuss the project.
meanings.sent3: He bothered to bake a cake for his friend's birthday.
meanings.sent4: She bothered to learn a new language over the summer.
meanings.sent5: They bothered to plant a garden in their backyard for fresh vegetables.
